title: Mars rover trials
summary: Rover trials in a quarry in the UK showing a four-wheeled rover, known as Codi, using its robotic arm and a powerful computer vision system to pick up sample tubes.

title: Rocket Report: Falcon 9 lifts its 7,000th Starlink; ABL cuts deep
summary: "Branson was determined to be the first billionaire in space."

title: Hubble Examines a Busy Galactic Center
summary: This NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image features the spiral galaxy IC 4709a located around 240 million light-years away in the southern constellation Telescopium. Hubble beautifully captures its faint halo and swirling disk filled with stars and dust bands. The compact region at its core might be the most remarkable sight. It holds an active galactic […]

title: Debris from DART impact could reach Earth
summary: In 2022 NASA’s DART spacecraft made history, and changed the Solar System forever, by impacting the Dimorphos asteroid and measurably shifting its orbit around the larger Didymos asteroid. In the process a plume of debris was thrown out into space.

title: First metal part 3D printed in space
summary: ESA’s Metal 3D Printer has produced the first metal part ever created in space.

title: Earth from Space: Sentinel-2 captures Sentinel-2
summary: The Copernicus Sentinel-2B satellite captured this image over Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana on 2 September, just ahead of the Sentinel-2C launch.

title: SpaceX launches third batch of satellites for NRO’s proliferated constellation
summary: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket on Sept. 5 launched the NROL-113 mission for the National Reconnaissance Office.

title: China’s secretive reusable spaceplane lands after 267 days in orbit
summary: HELSINKI — China’s experimental reusable spaceplane returned to Earth late Thursday, completing its third orbital mission. State media Xinhua issued a brief report on Sept. 5 (Eastern), confirming the spacecraft’s […]

title: Persevering Through the Storm
summary: It’s dust-storm season on Mars! Over the past couple of weeks, as we ascended the Jezero Crater rim, our science team has monitored increasing dust in the atmosphere — typically highest around this time of the Martian year.

title: Blue Origin racing to meet tight launch window for first New Glenn mission
summary: While preparations for the first launch of Blue Origin’s New Shepard rocket are accelerating, the company acknowledges there is “lots to do” to get the vehicle ready to meet a narrow launch window next month.
